channel.title: Suspected smf permission problem
channel.description: I'm trying to install this package but everytime I tick the "install package" button it gives me a 403. Which file(s) would I need to set the permission to 775 on? I tried just doing the whole folder 775 but it didnt feel like changing so that wont work. Any ideas?

item.title: Suspected smf permission problem
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:3, topic:481254”]Well, I am actually uploading the mods which do so succesfully. Once the mod is finished uploading I click install and that is when it gives me the 403 page. I tried changeing everything to 755 and that did not solve the issue.

I have a feeling your right about the host because this is the first time I’ve ever encountered this issue. If I can be sure it is the host, im eventually getting with hostgator so it wont matter.[/quote]

You’re going to have to ask your host about this because it seems like it’s a permissions/ownership problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Suspected smf permission problem
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

Well, I am actually uploading the mods which do so succesfully. Once the mod is finished uploading I click install and that is when it gives me the 403 page. I tried changeing everything to 755 and that did not solve the issue.

I have a feeling your right about the host because this is the first time I’ve ever encountered this issue. If I can be sure it is the host, im eventually getting with hostgator so it wont matter.

Read full topic

item.title: Suspected smf permission problem
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

This is where you’re installing packages from the SMF site directly right? Uploading packages work fine?

I have a feeling your host is being a bit fickle with permissions, not SMF itself. Can you explain your problem again when you tried CHMODing please; I didn’t really get what you mean when you said “it didn’t feel like changing”. I assume nothing actually changed?

Read full topic
